Summary Accomplished Technical Carrier Account Manager with extensive experience in technical acceptance of innovative Mobile devices, Wearables and Accessories that focuses on delighting end consumer experience. 
 
Background and extensive experience with AT&T, T-Mobile USA, Cricket Wireless and international partners in negotiating technical requirements, product scope and executing product launches that have included mobile devices and software services.  
 
Recently managed products: 
- Nexus 6 (Stock Sku) 
- Moto X (1st gen & 2nd gen) 
- Moto G (1st gen & 2nd gen) 
- Moto E (1st gen & 2nd gen) 
 
Obsessively passionate about end user experience with great focus on things that matters to customers, and seek to solve everyday problems in innovative ways. Experience Sr. Technical Account Manager and Sales Support - North America Motorola Mobility, a Lenovo Company October 2014  – Present (11 months) San Francisco Bay Area ● Managed daily customer facing operations, including planning for New Product introductions, certification, requirements and delivery of all AT&T handsets in an extremely fast paced environment. “Go to” person for cross functional internal teams as well as for AT&T, T-Mobile and Cricket Wireless for all certification related activities.  
● Optimized time to market by constantly looking for new opportunities in processes and communicating between internal teams as well as collaborating with sales, marketing, and product teams on new product launches.  
● Reduced cost of proto samples resulting into significant savings for the company.  
● Launched over 8 New Products (including award winning Moto G, Moto 360, Moto X, Google Nexus 6 and accessories) between AT&T, Cricket and T-Mobile while supporting 12 OS / HW updates between AT&T, Cricket Wireless and T-Mobile USA.  
● Supported internal sales team with product queries, crafting technical responses for sales executives at customer end, supporting RFP requests and communicating internally the key customer requirements at various Tier levels to ensure key HW and SW services are supported.  
● Successfully negotiated roadblocks within AT&T and Cricket technical and marketing team.  
● Negotiated several dates ahead of schedule and backend activities that resulted into first to market.  
● Effectively managed over 15 3rd party app developers and worked with cross functional team to ensure the apps permissions were safe from security and legal perspective. Sr. Technical Account Manager for AT&T, T-Mobile USA and Cricket Wireless Carrier Motorola Mobility, a Google Company May 2012  –  October 2014  (2 years 6 months) San Francisco Bay Area ● Successfully launched several award winning Premium and Value category devices in N.American market for Top Tier Carrier Partners such as AT&T, T-Mobile and Cricket Wireless.  
● Responsible for the overall technical management of carrier certification activities from product ranging to launch. Principal Technical Account Manager for AT&T and T-Mobile Carrier Motorola Mobility May 2002  –  May 2012  (10 years 1 month) Greater Seattle Area ●	Management of technical acceptance and relationship between AT&T SPE VC / Marketing and Motorola. 
●	Reduced and controlled expenses by quality control, Identification of quality workarounds and on time market launch. Avoided multiple SW spins and associated 3rd party retesting costs.  
●	Coordinated 3rd party test activities including accessory IOT in accordance with Carrier requirement for Technical Acceptance.  
●	Disseminated technical information with justification for implementation to appropriate groups & followed through until committed. 
●	Participated in review of customer compliance document and stability scripts to ensure compliance. 
●	Managed quality scorecard performance from TAM perspective - pre and post launch technical support, pre Lab and Lab approval process, Minimizing Escaped defects, Time to Market.  
●	Executed Field Testing of mobile handsets, assisted in troubleshooting of field/lab issues and new technology testing in Carrier labs, Supported AT&T ADAPT testing and Bring up of AT&T Control Plane + Secured User Plane location using Andrew system, Field E911 testing. Technical Account Manager Motorola Personal Communication Sector December 1998  –  April 2002  (3 years 5 months) South Randolph, NJ ● Wireless handset development and technical approvals for North America GSM carriers.  
● Supported Emerging GSM accounts i.e. Omnipoint, PacBell, BellSouth Mobility,  
Managed end to end technical approval of wireless handsets from Voicestream, T-Mobile USA.  
● Developed Strong Relationship with responsible carrier SME and Product Line Manager internally.  
● Supported New Technology Testing / CES show / sales training, development in Carrier labs – AMR/HR, Link adaptation, GPRS, WAP. Field Design Engineer and Carrier support Philips Consumer Cellular December 1997  –  December 1998  (1 year 1 month) Piscataway, New Jersey Supported Technical approval of Mobile devices for customers (Entel PCS, Chile, Pacbell Wireless, Voice Stream, Bell South). 
 
●	Supported Technical approval for various customers, deployed required tools and provided their needs in terms of satisfaction, value, quality and speed.  
●	INTERNATIONAL ASSIGNMENTS: Met with the customer (Entel) in Santiago, Chili regarding technical approval of 1900 PCS GSM single band product.  
●	Validated and supported development of GSM dual band product of Philips Consumer Communications in Le Mans, France for a month.  
●	Field testing / Product development in European countries: Zurich, Switzerland / Germany / Paris, France  
● Field tested in various markets to optimize RF performance by conducting Call Processing Tests. 
●	Established drive routes in consultation with service provider/customer, Pass/Fail determination– based on confirmation that mobile is on Voice channel.  
●	Captured significant test data via the following methods: time stamps, comments on failure mode, Environment, Infrastructure conditions, RSSI – range of values on the route, Speed, Individual phone behavior, Messages on display and tracing files. Field Test Engineer - Mobile Devices LUCENT TECHNOLOGIES June 1997  –  December 1997  (7 months) Holmdel, NJ ●	Field testing in different Cellular markets, Call Processing Tests, established Routes in consultation with service provider/customer.  
●	Trained new people on tools, troubleshooting techniques, S/W, testing strategies and objectives.  
●	Analyzed test results with team to confirm failure mode and provide modified versions of HW/Firmware/DSP for further analysis and performance improvement. 
●	Wrote test plans and test reports for validation. QA Engineer C & H Associates, Inc December 1995  –  May 1997  (1 year 6 months) New Jersey ●	Black Box testing of software products using SQA package in marketing environment.  
●	The system kept track of updated information of orders, stocks from each unit.  
●	The system sub-modules took track of entire invoicing package functions of orders received by sales person working at their client site to the back office at another location.  
●	The project also involved in alerting the management when the stock was below the reorder level.  
●	Managed test planning and design, test development and execution, viewing, analyzing results and defect tracking using SQA Manager, SQA Robot, SQA Test Log Viewer and SQA Comparators. - Excel on elegant designs, development paradigms and high software quality 
- Experienced in leading software development teams, using Scrum and Agile development methodologies 
- Extensive background in product development cycles, effective cross functional communication and understanding technical and business aspects 
- Work experience spanning four different countries 
 
Technical specialties

 Experience Sr. Partner Technology Manager - Search Google December 2012  – Present (2 years 9 months) San Francisco Bay Area Lead for civic and electoral data acquisition, driving Google’s Politics & Elections programs.

Crisis Response: 
Launched Crisis Response in various countries, working with government and NGOs. 
- Coordinated partner technical discussions, establishing project plans and driving integration. 
 
Civics & Elections: 
- Set up Google landing pages for multiple world elections, collaborating with regional teams. 
- Drove elections data acquisition in Italy, Australia, India, Brazil, US. 
- Wrote data fetching and parsing components in Python and Java. Sr. Technical Account Manager - Commerce Google February 2011  –  November 2012  (1 year 10 months) San Francisco Bay Area Google Wallet 
- Initial launch of NFC Google Wallet. Drove merchant integration, defining processes and best practices for system integrators. 
 
Internal payments platform

Buy with Google 
- Drove initial partner integrations for the project, while on stealth mode before launch. 
 Principal Software Engineer Nokia July 2009  –  March 2011  (1 year 9 months) Copenhagen Area, Denmark Led and designed Qt based applications and components based for the Symbian platform. 
Defined collaboration methodologies with third-party SW providers and aligned technical efforts across MeeGo and Symbian as needed, mainly in Qt Mobility API definition. 
Founded a new Differentiating Software team in Copenhagen, providing internal trainings and guidance. The main focus was ramping up on C++, Symbian and the optimal infrastructure for software development. 
Mentored 15 senior software developers and architects on the site's initial projects, from the project's initial architecture definition phase, through the development phase and until architecture verification. 
 Services Senior Engineer (Short Term Internal Transfer) Nokia Oulu January 2010  –  March 2010  (3 months) Finland Formed part of the elite team working in Ovi Contacts for Nokia N8, working with Qt Web Runtime technology. 
Owned the Single Sign On integration effort. I worked closely with multiple teams around the globe, responsible for the client component and back end. 
Recommended Nokia's Client Platform team on ways to improve APIs, verification methodologies and overall design. My main focus was on the Software Update flows and SSO. SW Concepting Specialist Nokia Copenhagen January 2009  –  July 2009  (7 months) Copenhagen Area, Denmark As Software Chief I handled all software concepting activities in the product program. 
Collaborated with the program’s leadership team and key stakeholders, to help define the product story in a holistic way. 
Established an excellent internal network with teams in multiple software organizations worldwide. 
Coached other team members in our Copenhagen software concepting organization, regarding the Symbian structure and processes. 
Assisted the global software concepting architecture team in reviewing some software studies prepared for other concepting programs. Senior Software Engineer Nokia San Diego March 2004  –  January 2009  (4 years 11 months) Greater San Diego Area Scrum Master and Team Lead in San Diego for the AT&T specific features. In this role, I worked together with the main development team in Bangalore, and the architecture team in Finland. 
Led development for illumination control of the first S60 device created in San Diego, collaborating with Hardware, Software and Middle-ware teams, as well as Product Management. 
- Worked with many software layers in the device, from UI customization, middleware, HW abstraction and device drivers. In this project, I defined the overall architecture and expanded the needed APIs according to the product program needs. 
 
Designed and developed custom operator requirements for Sprint handsets for the first Nokia handsets approved in Sprint's network. 
 
Led integration work of Nokia PictureMail, using Lightsurf's Multimedia Communications Library. 
- Coordinated development activities with Lightsurf software counterparts, positively influencing their system design in order to meet mobile software requirements. 
- Negotiated PictureMail compliancy with Sprint representatives to resolve gating issues. 
 
Led UI customization project targeting Brazilian operator Vivo, achieving 5 mobile phone approvals according to the original schedule.
